Notes: Knief (2015) states Methylococcaceae do not contain non-methanotrophic bacteria (with Crenothrix discussed as an exception/edge case). For 16S ASVs lacking genus resolution, family-level inclusion is defensible.
Knief (2015) states Methylothermaceae do not contain non-methanotrophic bacteria. Family-level inclusion is defensible when genus is unresolved.
Verrucomicrobial methanotroph family in Knief (2015) Table 3; genus is often unresolved in short 16S regions, so family-level inclusion is typically the right move.

Knief (2015) notes Methylocystaceae includes additional non-methanotrophic genera. Therefore: do NOT count all family-level ASVs as 'known' methanotrophs; treat unclassified-family ASVs as putative only.
Knief (2015) notes Beijerinckiaceae includes additional non-methanotrophic genera. Therefore: family-level hits are putative only; genus-level whitelist gives 'known'.

Crenothrix is discussed as methanotrophic and placed in Crenotrichaceae; Knief notes this classification is questioned and may fall within Methylococcaceae based on 16S. Recommend treating Crenothrix/Crenotrichaceae as putative in 16S unless you explicitly want to include it.

Category: Phylum too broad for methanotroph classification
Notes: SILVA 138 Methylomirabilota (= NC10) contains both Methylomirabilales (methanotrophic) and Rokubacteriales (not methanotrophic). Use Family,Methylomirabilaceae for targeted matching instead of phylum-level.
Cultivated methanotroph genus in Knief Table 1; some species/strains can be facultative on multicarbon substrates but remain methanotrophic.
Cultivated methanotroph genus in Knief Table 1; facultative growth reported in some strains but still methanotrophic.
Cultivated Beijerinckiaceae methanotroph genus in Knief Table 1 (some species facultative).
Cultivated Beijerinckiaceae methanotroph genus in Knief Table 1; notable for facultative lifestyle and often lacks pMMO (pmoA), which is why pmoA surveys can miss it.
Cultivated Beijerinckiaceae methanotroph genus in Knief Table 1; also lacks pMMO (pmoA) per Knief discussion.
Cultivated Methylococcaceae methanotroph genus in Knief Table 2.
Cultivated Methylococcaceae methanotroph genus in Knief Table 2.

Cultivated verrucomicrobial methanotroph genus in Knief Table 3.
Cultivated verrucomicrobial methanotroph genus in Knief Table 3.
Included by Knief as anaerobic nitrite-dependent methanotroph (Table 3). Mark as 'known' only if your scope includes anaerobic methanotrophy; otherwise treat as putative/habitat-dependent.
Discussed by Knief; not a cultivated genus in the 18-count, and its family placement is debated. Treat as putative if you include it at all in 16S.
SILVA 138 reports genus as 'Crenothrix' (without Candidatus prefix) under Methylomonadaceae. Methanotrophic but lacks cultivated type strain; treat as putative.
Discussed by Knief as lacking cultivated representatives and not validated; treat as putative if you include it at all.

Category: Exclusive methanotroph family (SILVA 138 equivalent of Methylococcaceae)
Notes: In SILVA 138 this family sits under Methylococcales and contains classical gammaproteobacterial methanotroph genera (Methylobacter, Methyloglobulus, Crenothrix, pLW-20). No known non-methanotrophic genera in this cluster. Functionally equivalent to Methylococcaceae in Knief (2015).
If your classifier reports the family Methylomirabilaceae (NC10), treat analogously to NC10: include if anoxic niches are relevant; otherwise exclude or report separately.
